website_summaries.verdict: Not just a humorous survival guide for first-time dads, but also a handy guide for solutions for common problems.
pros: A truly funny book with hilarious illustrations
advice doled out in bite-sized portions with pictures
Cuts to the chase, which men like
Women are also fans of this book over their "boring" and lengthy expectant-mother books
cons: Some readers don’t like the sarcastic tone of this book
Some information is outdated and possibly sexist, like the tech portion

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This book is great! Funny and informative- I got it for my husband but enjoyed it myself and recommended it to friends. It’s an easy read, and filled with funny, useful illustrations. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Roser

customer_reviews.title: Very Practical
customer_reviews.text: Boy Scouts Motto, "Be Prepared". This new Dad recommends it. Even if you don't use any of the info in it or if you are absolutely not involved physically or emotionally in your partner/wife's pregnancy. Because the simple fact that you took time to read this tells me that is not likely you. This book will certainly help you keep your head in the game, when that first contraction happens. The birthing classes help but a quick refresher and reread never hurts.
customer_reviews.author: B-arlyn

customer_reviews.title: Smart, funny and insightful read for expecting and new dads.
customer_reviews.text: Informative and damn funny. It even has illustrations. For the lazy reader this book is for you. It's like I'm getting solid advice from a close pal over beers. I may have even enjoyed a beer or two while reading this. Fortunately my kid will survive in my care now.
customer_reviews.author: Mustard_no_Ketchup

customer_reviews.title: Decent read for new dads - do your own research
customer_reviews.text: I am a millennial new dad who appreciates new research and fully supports the idea there are always better ways to do things. This book sets out a good baseline of what to expect and how to prepare for a new baby. Unfortunately some of the suggestions have proven completely wrong over the years and there is better research out there now. I highly suggest doing your own research on any facts that are presented in the book.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Offensive and misogynistic; save your money
customer_reviews.text: My husband stopped reading after the first few chapters. This is directed at a complete moron who doesn't have a real interest in his wife or family. The chapter about pretending that intimacy is more important than sex was disgusting. And if your husband is jealous of your baby feeding off of your breast you have bigger problems than what can be explained in this book. This was written as if it was explaining the excitement and love of starting a family to a drunk frat and was utterly offensive to both my husband and myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: skips all the crap, gets to the point
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely written for guys, skips all the crap, gets to the point. Although its really more of a book for once the baby is born, not really a great precursor book.
customer_reviews.author: J. Talley

customer_reviews.title: Funny and Informative!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my hubs/dad-to-be, we both read the beginning since neither of us know much of anything at all. I dig how the info is presented, it's a quick, no frills, how to keep baby (and partner!) alive during this crazy time, with some funny jokes thrown in. We're not about to read all those other books, so it's pretty great, though only the first few chapters are on actual baby stuff, then it goes to toddler tips, and so we're waiting to go forward till we can wrap our heads around this first part.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: SEXIST AND RACIST
customer_reviews.text: SEXIST AND RACIST - this book is so binary, and there is SO MUCH toxic masculinity. Would NOT recommend to anyone. So horrible..
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Great book! Smart, funny, useful! A must buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun and funny book to read, with great information. I bought it for my husband, and he loves it. I was jealous because all of my pregnancy books were so boring and unfunny in comparison. I also enjoyed reading this book! Great diagrams and humorous drawings as well. Definitely get it if you're going to be a new dad or mom! Most importantly, its not of the "you're a guy so you must be an idiot stereotypical clueless dad to be" type. It doesn't talk down to you. We loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Recommended easy read for a first time father
customer_reviews.text: Bought this book for our first pregnancy. My wife is now full term, and so far this book has been very helpful. It is an easy-read with lots of graphics. I can pick it up whenever I have a question, and find the section that I need. It is not something that has to be read cover to cover. There are some great tips and pieces of advice that have saved us some potential headaches and even arguments. I wish there was an online component for when I am on the go. Recommended for a father-to-be.
customer_reviews.author: christopher taveras

customer_reviews.title: Funny and informative
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed thus bok so much when we were expecting. We've since bought it for every new pregnancy in our friends group. It's a nice change to some of the scary be prepared books. It informs you with s nice but of satire. Great for the dad to be that doesn't really want to be lectured.
customer_reviews.author: Piratmun

customer_reviews.title: THE PERFECT GIFT for a NEW DAD!
customer_reviews.text: Within minutes of picking up this book, myself and my wife were bent over laughing! The day after I gave it to a friend, they'd already learned something new for their little one, despite already having two older kids. (It'd been a few years, thus I thought the book would be a good refresher ; ) Later on, his wife commented too on how funny, and practical, some of the tips were too!
customer_reviews.author: Mister Griffith

customer_reviews.title: An amusing but informative book for new dads
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father-to-be son-in-law. It was purchased more for amusement, but it turned out to have some practical and good advice. Some of it I thought was a little silly, but he got a big kick out of it, and, as I said, it does contain some good information presented in an amusing way.
customer_reviews.author: S. Daily

customer_reviews.title: Prefect book for first times dads
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband and I actually ended up ready it before he did. 😂 I found it very informative and also humorous. I think it’s a great book for first times dads and provides all the important information they should know. It’s also gives very helpful ways to contribute as a father and help with the newborn phase while mother is still healing from birth which I thought was awesome. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Rose M

customer_reviews.title: Straight forward, humorous
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband to read. Hes a very practical, no nonsense, no touchy feely guy and he loved this book. It's straight forward, humerous and has a bunch of real world tips and information we both can use. I highly recommend this for all new dads that want a simple straight forward book of information you'll actually use.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada Baker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for husband!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to add to the 'We're having a baby!' surprise announcement for him. It arrived like new in a plastic case. I like that it feels as a textured manual with illustrations and, flipping through it, it seems full of how to help mom (SCORE) and humorous excerpts. It looks like it goes through pregnancy to the first year. He hasn't read it yet but I hope he finds it helpful!
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Buy This for any new dad!
customer_reviews.text: My bf doesnt like to read (unless about gaming or stupid stuff like that😂) so when I became pregnant I knew I needed to get tricky & then found this book! I myself was even just cracking up w the little pictures! Such a great book for any 1st time dad (or any man who will be helping out a lot) It is really easy to read/comprehend & like I said it has a funny feel to the book which is good to keep their attention away from the games🤣 A lot of great information & funny pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Kenfab

customer_reviews.title: Outdated and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Throughout the book there places obviously need an update. I found myself constantly going to internet to validate if their advice is still the case, which eventually defeated the purpose of getting this book from the beginning. Just for a flavor - the book even had a section on 'how to block a VCR box properly as babies are likely attracted by them'. It also suggested babies can sleep in the infant car carrier through 6 months which is dangerous and could suffocate a baby.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not just for Dads!
customer_reviews.text: Got this book for my husband and he loves it! He keeps quoting things from the book and has seemed to learn a lot from it. I even started reading it and it’s amazing! So much detail but straight forward with a few jokes to make you laugh along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good read for new parents
customer_reviews.text: My son is now 15 months old. I read this just before he was born and have just read it again. Many of the ideas and suggestions came in handy. Items for a diaper bag, flying with baby, and feeding him were all extremely helpful. Keep in mind that every kid is different. If you try any of these ideas or a variation you and your little one will have a fun and successful first year.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This book is super fun! I got it for my husband and I find myself reading it often. While maybe not the most comprehensive, it’s designed to attract a male audience with pictures and creativity! I would say even those who don’t read often. Highly recommended for new dad’s! Would also be a great little gift.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. My wife bought it for me as a gift since we have our first baby on the way. I've really enjoyed reading it. Great advice and how-to's on the basics and it's funny! I'd definitely recommend this to all the new fathers at there.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic book for new dads
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband to tell him I was pregnant. This was an excellent buy and he dutifully read the whole thing. He knew things I didn’t even know after reading it. The author does a great job of providing information in an interesting way and covers all of the important topics. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: prettyplease

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, hilarious and helpful
customer_reviews.text: Love this book! I bought it as a first father's day gift for my husband but I think it is helpful and funny for dads or moms! Super practical advice, hilarious illustrations and captions and seriously makes you laugh out loud while still actually being useful. I feel like ditching all those super serious mommy books and just looking stuff up in here when I have questions. Definitely a stress reliever!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon H.

customer_reviews.title: Funny, Informative, Must-Read!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book. Got it in the mail yesterday and finished it today before shipping it off to my deployed husband. The book was very informative while being interesting and funny. It didn’t discuss pregnancy much, just the practical steps and procedures once the child is born. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HonestAbe

customer_reviews.title: Funny Yet Extremely Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect gift for my husband. I wanted something that would help him prepare for our first child, but worried that a normal baby book would bore him (he's not much one for self-help books in general). This was the perfect solution! It's hilarious, and very informative, and reminds me of a boy-scout manual in its level of practical detail. When my brother-in-law saw the diagram entitled "what your newborn actually will look like" (cone-head and splotchy skin included) he confessed "I was a little alarmed when my first son came out with a cone-head. I thought there was something wrong with him." If only he had had this book to warn him!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Josephson

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! Funny but not annoying
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. My husband loved it, then I picked it up and loved it too! Great advice. Written in 2004 but still all practical solid advice and tips. Funny but not annoying. Will definitely get this as a gift for our friends.
customer_reviews.author: goodman duke

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this book. Of all the books I got him, this was his favorite. I'd seriously catch him laughing at night reading it. It's factual and funny. It would make a great gift to any new dad.
customer_reviews.author: Kalee

customer_reviews.title: Best Book For New Dads
customer_reviews.text: This book is awesome. If you’re a first time dad who doesn’t want to spend a lot of time reading boring books but still want to have some idea of what to do once the baby comes, get this book. It’s to the point, written for dads, has information not only about the baby but also about how other aspects of your life will change, and it’s funny as h*ll
customer_reviews.author: MikeDC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and informative
customer_reviews.text: This book is an easy to read guide for men navigating new waters of fatherhood. It's nice because the information isn't masked in extensive fabrication, but rather simple straight to the point and in a humurous manner.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for scared fathers-to-be
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 books for my husband and the first was a full of scary stuff that made it sound like we'd just ruined our lives. So I told him to stop reading and try this one. And it's much better. A bit out dated but overall full of useful information. And even better, he said it's an easy read (and he's not a big reader).
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: A true Dad’s guide to Dadding. Recommend for all.
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend for new dads. So far everything has been spot on. It’s my go-to gift for new dads. In a world where all of the info is geared towards mom, this book nails dadding. It’s wit isn’t condescending as found in some apps and other “dad guides” and the information is well presented.
customer_reviews.author: Nick m

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful. Being a father is the best hardest thing I have ever done. This book is matter of fact but not in a sharp way and funny but not in a snarky way
customer_reviews.author: CJ Stenzel

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining and useful.
customer_reviews.text: I got this fir my husband when we found out I was pregnant. He loved it and so did I. Not only does it actually have relevant useful info but it's pretty amusing. It was his favorite of the books I got him about parenting.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Has real, useful info
customer_reviews.text: Our baby is due in January and I bought this for my husband (along with some actual survival guide books) as kind of a joke for his birthday in July. I was expecting it to be silly based on the back cover, but he's been reading it and says it has lots of useful information.
customer_reviews.author: JMHP

customer_reviews.title: Well Written and Funny
customer_reviews.text: Well Written and Funny, as a new dad it has helped me know some of the things to expect. Has the feel and look of a boy scout handbook. It is great to read front to back and to look things up in as needed
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Nice for First Time Dads While Mom is Still Pregnant!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good book BEFORE baby comes. Unfortunately, I bought for my son after his kids were about nine months old and he had already learned much of this the hard way.... :)
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Kimbell-Meaney

customer_reviews.title: The best parenting book we received!
customer_reviews.text: Not only did I buy this book for my husband when we were expecting, but TWO friends gave it to us as gifts (we've regifted to other expectant parents :) ). Incredibly practical and funny, written in bite-sized chunks that are easy to digest, with good ideas for moms as well as dads. Don't be without it! UPDATE: The day after I posted this review, we received a THIRD gift copy of this book (even though our daughter is now 3 months old!). Clearly, several of our friends with kids are endorsing it, too. Seriously, don't be without it!
customer_reviews.author: jab

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to laugh as you learn
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to read as a first time father thinking he would learn some useful tips. However I decided to read it myself and haven't laughed so hard at a parenting book ever. The writing hilariously describes the first year of a baby's life with illustrations that match the absurdity and truth of new parenthood. From the descriptions of a woman following birth to the "baby exercise circuit" I found the advice to be amusing but also practical. I appreciated the ability to quickly read through the book as most parenting books are very thick and can be overwhelming. I would recommend this book to any new father ( and mother too).
customer_reviews.author: jamisoncollette

customer_reviews.title: Husband Likes It
customer_reviews.text: Overall, my husband has liked this book. He's actually read it as we plan for our first baby. There are some dated references as other reviewers have mentioned. Even still it's informative and entertaining. Easy read. Would recommend has a gift for a first time dad-to-be.
customer_reviews.author: KCS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great book with a lot of helpful information that is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book with a lot of helpful information that is to the point, and humorous. My only note is that the book would be even better with an update. It was written in 2004 so some of the info about technology, such as photographing and filming a baby, is out of date and no longer an issue. (There are a few pages on how to easily extract items from a VCR that a baby has shoved in there.) Still a great book, and I'm sure any new dad would love it!
customer_reviews.author: cubed10

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book for any man
customer_reviews.text: This a great book for practical men. We have it to a friend who is a veteran and whose wife is expecting their first child. He calls it his tactical parenting book. A great gift for dads who are getting lost in the shuffle of a new baby.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: So funny
customer_reviews.text: Such a funny yet informative book. I bought it for my husband before our baby was born to put it in his new dad basket for the hospital and it was a hit. So so good.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Best baby book for normal parents
customer_reviews.text: Best book out there. It's written like and instruction manual but funny. I've read a bunch of books but the problem is you only focus on what stage or age you baby is at the time and don't remember the rest. I glanced through it once but go back to it all the time as my baby grows up. Some of the best tips I got was from this book. Not just for guys.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for new parents!!
customer_reviews.text: New dad? Dad again? This book is perfect for those parents that want great advice and tips to help you with the little watermelons in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Donbran

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for any new dad
customer_reviews.text: Great book! The illustrations are fun, the advice is humorous but also really down to earth and useful. I bought this for my husband because he had no interest in reading my books about babies, and he really enjoyed it. He picked up some tips that I hadn't, and I think it helped him approach parenting more confidently. I'd give this book as a gift to any male friend of mine about to have a baby.
customer_reviews.author: BethJoy

customer_reviews.title: Cute. Funny. A little outdated in 2019.
customer_reviews.text: Really cute and funny book. Bought for my hubby to make him feel more involved...he really likes it. It's an easy read and you dont need to sit down and spend a lot of time on it...you can just thumb through to what interests you. A couple things are outdated but we don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Herrema

customer_reviews.title: Good for first-time dads
customer_reviews.text: Had some good tips here and there. If anything, it probably helped reduce some of the stress for me before the baby was born because it has some funny parts also. I still look through it from time to time just to get an idea of how to do something . I'd say this is more beneficial to first-time dads.
customer_reviews.author: cmoo

customer_reviews.title: Great book for first time dads!
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly wonderful book for expectant dads! My husband loves to read and really enjoyed this book. Our first copy we got for free from our visiting nurse, but my husband has gifted this book several times to our friends that are becoming first time dads.
customer_reviews.author: amymarie03

customer_reviews.title: Book for men/women about a baby coming
customer_reviews.text: HI, Awesome book! Easy to read/fun way to present topics/pictures. Very fantastic book! Very good information in the book that is very useful! Thank you for making this awesome book! Happiness...
customer_reviews.author: Shasha

customer_reviews.title: No baby no cry!
customer_reviews.text: Before our daughter was born I was overloaded with information and parenting books. This one stands out as the best. It's funny - sometimes very funny, but has nuggets of helpful info buried throughout. I've passed mine on to a nephew and bought another for my brother-in-law. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Natroneous

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome
customer_reviews.text: This book is so fun to read and my boyfriend actually picked it up and started reading it without me prompting him and he loves it too. Its funny and light and most importantly its practical which i think makes it ideal for men who tend to be much more practical in their approach to many things. Even though I am much more detail oriented I also enjoyed reading it and it gave me some super valuable information .
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Useful info, delivered with humor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband based on a suggestion from a friend, before we had our baby. He liked it, and found it full of useful advice entertainingly delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Chirkenduce

customer_reviews.title: Great for expecting fathers!
customer_reviews.text: There's lots of pictures & good advice! Makes a great gift for expecting fathers.
customer_reviews.author: Kat R

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious
customer_reviews.text: This book is full of hilarious reading for dads to be. It is geared more toward expecting fathers of girls than boys but could work for both. Bought for one guy friend and now have to buy for all my expecting father friends.
customer_reviews.author: andrea civiello

customer_reviews.title: Funny & to the point
customer_reviews.text: Great for first time dads who don’t know much, some of the examples are outdated but that’s to be expected with its rustic to the point humor making childcare fun
customer_reviews.author: Casey L Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Practical and funny
customer_reviews.text: This book is both practical and humorous. The only downfall is that it's a little out of date. (Talks about VCR's and camcorders). Could use a 2019 revision.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: ...And New Moms!
customer_reviews.text: This book is full of great advice and humor while being succinct enough to finish in a couple sittings. It's only dad-specific in that it's funny (i.e. it's not dad-specific at all)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: As a nurse I've had so much professional experience with newborns and older kids that I thought I was well equipped to be a mother. This book was given to us for my husband, but it is full of advice and tips that I also found useful and didn't know! This is hands down the best book we've found for any new parent. I think we focus on childbirth education too much as a culture, and we don't do enough to provide support to new parents after the birth. This book helps fill in that gap. It is also written in such a hilarious way that it is a wonderful book for any parent to read!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Hagedorn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend as a giggle gift after finding out that we were expecting and very unexpected little one! I figured it would be full of funny animations and humorous stories, which it is, but it is also packed full of useful information that apply to first time dads (and moms!). It was a better gift than expected!
customer_reviews.author: BAC005

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has very much enjoyed learning the essentials of first time daddyhood from this book. He loved it so much we bought another copy for a friendly who is also expecting his first daughter! Great book!
customer_reviews.author: MBL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly informative and helpful book. As a new dad my good friend got this for me as a gift before my son was born. My wife and I read it twice. It has been a huge help. We have already gave 3 copies away as gifts and recommended it to a few of my clients. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D Ensenat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect New Daddy Book
customer_reviews.text: Such a fantastic Dad book! Gets across some important information in bite sizes - perfect for daddy's that aren't too big into reading lenghty books about baby stuff!
customer_reviews.author: swissgirl

customer_reviews.title: For Dads With Short Attention Spans
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother-in-law when him and my sister were expecting. He said it was the best baby book he got. It's not set up like a text book, it's set up like a survival guide and it really knows its target audience. He found it interesting and informative compared to the more structured books that are easy to lose interest in.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Dad's love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband on our upcoming birth of our son. He loved it! It's simple and easy to follow along with pictures. He is a simple man and wants simple instructions. I was told about this book from a male co-worker of mine. Seems like this is the "it" book for dads to be!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Moonan

customer_reviews.title: some questionable advice, somewhat dated, but alright
customer_reviews.text: There's some advice in here that I definitely won't follow (like how to put on a puppet show while driving), and these days I'm not too worried about my kid putting stuff in my VCR. But overall it's a quick read with some decent advice for the new dad (or mom), and at least gets you thinking about the types of challenges you'll encounter.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Fun read.
customer_reviews.text: I won't say it's the best book I have read for baby care. But it's a delight to read and keeps your attention till the end. Some tricks are really good and original. The book somehow makes you feel more proud of being a father. If you are here, most probably you are a father. Congratulations. It's quite a nice place to be.
customer_reviews.author: Amit

customer_reviews.title: Helpful and not condescending
customer_reviews.text: This was very helpful. Funny and not condescending like some other similar books for new dads. A quick read too.
customer_reviews.author: Jameson Bull

customer_reviews.title: Great for expecting dads.
customer_reviews.text: A funny yet informative book that is great for dads to be!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and informative!!
customer_reviews.text: Just as most have already said, this book is full of wonderful info that a new dad will definitely need. My significant other is at 12 weeks now and this is a light read and one I will go back to many times. My favorite part is the author explaining the six different cries and how to acknowledge each one of them. Ive read a few other ones, and this one seems the most practical.
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: My husband loved this book
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this book. He thought it was hysterical and very helpful. Very light and to the point, which he liked. Definitely not a joke book like you may think just from the cover. He said he'll read it again for the next one. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Roes

customer_reviews.title: Great for a new dad!
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to a new dad. He said that he will actually enjoy reading it. Skip the books made for new moms. Along with some great advice, this one has humor just for the guys.
customer_reviews.author: valpad

customer_reviews.title: Great for new dads with active lifestyles
customer_reviews.text: I got this book for my husband who doesn't have much experience with how to handle babies. To my surprise the book is very informative and entertaining enough to keep my husbands interest. The book was printed a few years ago, so some of the text is a bit outdated when it comes to tech recommendations, but does provide some pretty good tips.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gift For You

customer_reviews.title: Outdated but not useless
customer_reviews.text: It’s quite outdated. I wish I’d known it was relevant like 20 years ago. But overall it was a big picture read and not totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Good for fathers, mothers, grandparents, babysitters, and more!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband as a pre-father's day present prior to the birth of our first child. Both of us have learned some really good skills and information from it, and I'm only about 1/3 of the way through! I would say this is an extremely practical guide. It's also broken up into short, easily digestible sections that could be perused anywhere from in the john to on an airplane flight. You can finish a section in a few minutes and not feel like you're struggling to finish it. I sneak it when he's not looking and read a little. This is a great book!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Funny and helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my guy, and he loves it. It's funny and helpful all at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Love this book.
customer_reviews.text: My husband read this with our first daughter and now we give it to all our pregnant friends. Great, practical, fun tips and ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: A gift that was a hit
customer_reviews.text: My nephew and his wife are expecting their first child in June. For their baby shower, I searched for gifts for the baby, the mom and the dad. While searching for the dad/my nephew, this was an Amazon suggestion that looked interesting. I had a chance to briefly look through the book before I wrapped it, and it had me chuckling. It has been about a month since he received the book, and I am told he tries to reads part of it every night. He reports that it is a really good book: he is finding the content covers more than expected, and that the book is funny.
customer_reviews.author: Country Refuge

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son - the father to be. Some comic relief and some good hints. He has enjoyed reading it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sarverwest

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this book for my brother, as he just found out that he will be a dad! :) I found the book to be an easy read and interesting myself. Wanting to find a book for first time dads since there are so many books for the moms. This is a great book to have as a parent or gift to someone else. The book was very prompt on arrival, excellent condition and is exactly what the picture looks like. Highly recommend this book, if you are search for a new dad gift item!
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: This book is a hoot. My son-in-law who is soon to be a Daddy has really been enjoying !!! Great gag gift (and so good advise too) for any expectant Father!
customer_reviews.author: Kim C

customer_reviews.title: Best Book For a NEW DAD
customer_reviews.text: Best book for new dads. This is the second one I've purchased. One for each of my sons, one with a year old and the other one with baby due in November. Filled with excellent information and organized in a way that is quick and easy for a new dad.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Tace

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ADVICE FOR ALL DADS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my son who was becoming a Daddy for the first time. HE LOVED IT!!! There are many useful ideas to "prepare" him for the duty of being a dad. He thought the idea of what to do with a balloon was so cute. There are ideas in the book that every dad should know, especially those becoming a dad for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Excellent (hilarious) gift for all the new dads
customer_reviews.text: Hilarious. Received this as a gift and bought one for another friend who is expecting. This is a funny and surprisingly helpful book for when your partner becomes pregnant, and has advice up through raising your new tiny human. Writing is witty, illustrations keep it light, and your partner will be impressed with some of the skills that you learn.
customer_reviews.author: MBlum

customer_reviews.title: Great for a first-time daddy
customer_reviews.text: Super cute book, with very important and helpful information. I knew this would be good starting at the first page. It shows a baby typical of whayou see on TV- plump cheeks, clean, smiling, ect. And then it shows what your baby will actually look like when it is born- wrinked, red, crying, ect. I thought this was perfect for first time dads, with not a lot of experience with children. Great read, and my husband said it was informative.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I've read numerous pregnancy books and parenting preparation books and bought this one for my husband because I wanted him to get a better taste of what we're in for. This book is so easy to read and has a lot of practical advice mixed with refreshing humor. I have read most of it myself and catch myself smiling when I see my husband being sucked into it as well. Definitely a worthy buy for dads to be!
customer_reviews.author: Abby Cook

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book for New Parents (Not Just Dads)
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this book! It was given to my husband as a Christmas gift and while it's aimed towards a male audience, as a new mom, I have enjoyed reading it and actually wish they made one similar for new moms. It has a lot of humor in it but also A LOT of practical and helpful information such as maintaining and cleaning breast pumps, swaddling, ideas on how to calm a crying baby, eating habits, etc.
customer_reviews.author: BlackKeys

customer_reviews.title: Best Father's Day gift
customer_reviews.text: Currently expecting and got this for the daddy, I opened it up and couldn't put it down. It's just a useful for women as it is for men! Looks cheesy, but there are great tips... First page talk about what you think baby will looks like (with example of a plump full of emotion 3 month old) and an actual newborn (looking old and wrinkly and thin)... I just thought every piece of this was so relevant, would buy it for every expecting father I know!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Brown

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves this book
customer_reviews.text: I am a little over 7 months pregnant and I got this book for my husband as one of his Christmas gifts. Right when he started to skim through if after opening he was already reading passages out loud and cracking up at the wording. It's very well written with a lot of helpful pictures. Since most books are directed towards moms to be I was usually the one with all of the baby knowledge and now he is telling me things that I didn't know, it has made him much more involved. Who knew that a book could do so much :) My dad also skimmed through it and said that he would like a copy. Very highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh M.

customer_reviews.title: Great gifts for dads-to-be
customer_reviews.text: Funny, informative & useful. Loved the sketches demonstrating things like how to swaddle. I buy it for all my friends who are about to become first-time dads.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great book for new parents
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review for my husband, who absolutely loved this book. He said that the easy-read and humorous nature of the book combined with the actual hints and instructions for how to deal with both me, and our new baby was great. He loved to read this book, he'd laugh and read me parts of it as well. I think if you're looking for a book for men to read about new babies, this is it! He likes it because it covers not only what to expect from the birth itself (what the baby will look like, act like, etc) but the different phases as they get older. How to deal with feedings, sickness, sleep patterns, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My husband and I have really enjoyed reading this together
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have really enjoyed reading this together. It's a great book for first time dads/parents. We love the little macgyver tips/tricks and solutions to some things that I/we had never heard of, but make perfect sense. It's a great read and guaranteed to have the two of you laughing. I'll definitely buy again for friends or at the very least suggest it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren L.

customer_reviews.title: Great book for expectant dads
customer_reviews.text: While I can attest to the genius of the book only after a year with my baby, i can say that it is an incredibly preparatory manual. Hilarious, fun, educational but just a bit outdated (too many mentions of cassette players and 1990's gadgets).
customer_reviews.author: Rohan

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME for the man who really isn't much of a reader! Kept my husband hooked!
customer_reviews.text: We are first time parents and I purchased this for my husband. He has trouble sitting down and reading a book because they do not keep his interest. He LOVES this book. He has really learned a lot, and enjoys the humor too! I definitely recommend for those men out there! Even if they are not big on reading!
customer_reviews.author: Paige Zwirner

customer_reviews.title: Great for all the dads!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband when we were expecting our baby. He loved it. He found it humorous but also helpful. He’s going to get a copy for his cousin who is expecting a baby soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ll

customer_reviews.title: Best dad book ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love the simple, Boy Scout handbook feel of this book. It's also quite funny at times, making it more interesting to read than most parenting books out there that my wife tends to pick up. It's also filled with very practical, real world advice, and I found that it has helped me prep for my little dude. It is kind of weird how it always refers to the baby as "she" (I was having/had a boy), but that's just a minor annoyance that I found. If you're a soon to be dad, this is definitely the book to get!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Informative & Funny!
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly enjoying reading this book. It has tons of great illustrations, and it is both informative and hilarious. It provides a lot of good tips and info without being too heavy/boring. I am preparing for the birth of my first child (my wife is in the second trimester). I am sure I will refer back to this book often as I am learning to be a Dad.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Very practical and easy to follow advice and good humor
customer_reviews.text: I have finished at least ten different pregnancy/parenting books when I decided to read this book which my husband never bother to read. I fell in love with the book immediately. In comparison to most of the books I have read, which are mostly dry and text-book like, this one has very good humor and offers easy to follow advice. The book teaches guys how to take care of their baby and help their partners to get through the difficult postpartum period. The book makes me laugh so much now my husband is reading.
customer_reviews.author: SHE

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for first time fathers
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun book with lots of practical information in it. I got this for my husband before our first child was born. We both enjoy it. It's full of helpful information with just enough humor to keep it interesting. Great book
customer_reviews.author: kmh87

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Guide for First Time Dads
customer_reviews.text: This book is exactly what I was looking for. It is geared towards men, without being condescending, or oversimplifying things. It has lots of good practical information, and the humor is subtle and does not get in the way of the information being presented. I have caught my wife reading it several times, because she liked it better than some of the books that she was reading. I would highly recommend this to any first time parent.
customer_reviews.author: montagnesed
